newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Two German soldiers killed in Bosnia shooting.
newsitem.headline: Two German soldiers killed in Bosnia shooting.

text.p: Two German soldiers serving in the NATO-led peace force in Bosnia were killed on Friday in a shooting accident in Sarajevo, a NATO spokesman said.

A third soldier was seriously wounded when a 20 mm cannon mounted on a patrol vehicle fired several rounds and hit an armoured personnel carrier nearby, Lieutenant Colonel Dieter Wiengarten told Reuters.
"We had a shooting accident. A 20mm cannon fired five to six rounds hitting the Fuchs (armoured vehicle) in front of it," he added.
It was not known why the cannon was fired near the Rajlovac camp on the outskirts of Sarajevo, which houses some of the German and French soldiers in the 31,000-strong Stabilisation Force (SFOR).
Germany sent some 2,000 peacekeeping troops to Bosnia this year, breaking a post-World War Two ban on the deployment of combat troops abroad.
